alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Oldham (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 18 at 11:27PM EDT until March 19 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Oldham County in central Kentucky... Northeastern Jefferson County in central Kentucky... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1127 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Strathmoor Manor, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Rolling Fields, Norbourne Estates, Meadowview Estates, Brownsboro Village, Mockingbird Valley, Springlee, Plymouth Village and Broad Fields around 1130 PM EDT. Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Hurstbourne, Graymoor-Devondale, Windy Hills, Hurstbourne Acres, St. Regis Park, Beechwood Village, Northfield and Woodlawn Park around 1135 PM EDT. Lyndon, Middletown, Douglass Hills, Prospect, Anchorage, Barbourmeade, Rolling Hills, Langdon Place, Plantation and Blue Ridge Manor around 1140 PM EDT. Worthington Hills and Coldstream around 1145 PM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
